intro: Calpidia corniculata, commonly known as the horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiky seed pods that resemble small horns, giving it its common name. The plant produces showy, bright red or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Calpidia corniculata is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other poppies and related species. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
